recipes.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.summary: A classic Italian pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and pepper.
instructions: Boil water: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Cook pasta: Add spaghetti and cook until al dente, about 8-10 minutes.
Prepare sauce: In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated Parmesan cheese.
Cook pancetta: In a large skillet, cook pancetta over medium heat until crispy.
Combine: Drain pasta and add it to the skillet with pancetta. Remove from heat and quickly stir in the egg mixture. Toss well to combine.
Serve: Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Chicken Stir-Fry
recipes.summary: A quick and easy Asian-inspired dish with chicken and vegetables.
instructions: Heat oil: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken: Add sliced chicken breasts and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Add vegetables: Add mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, snap peas) and stir-fry for another 5 minutes.
Make sauce: In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, garlic, ginger, and cornstarch. Pour into the pan and cook until the sauce thickens.
Serve: Serve over rice or noodles.

recipes.title: Cheesy Gnocchi
recipes.summary: Quick and easy cheesy bites with gnocchi, perfect for a comforting meal.
instructions: Boil water: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Cook gnocchi: Add gnocchi and cook until they float to the surface, about 3 minutes.
Prepare sauce: In a large skillet, melt butter and add minced garlic. Cook until fragrant.
Add gnocchi: Drain gnocchi and add to the skillet. Toss to coat.
Add cheese: Sprinkle with grated cheese (Parmesan or mozzarella) and stir until melted.
Serve: Garnish with fresh basil and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Lemon Salmon
instructions: Preheat Oven: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Prepare the Marinade: In a small bowl, combine the juice of one lemon, minced garlic, olive oil, chopped dill, salt, and pepper.
Marinate the Salmon: Place the salmon fillets in a baking dish and pour the marinade over them, ensuring each fillet is well-coated. Let them marinate for about 15 minutes to absorb the flavors.
Bake the Salmon: Arrange lemon slices on top of the salmon fillets. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve: Remove from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes. Serve the lemon salmon with your choice of side dishes, such as steamed vegetables, rice, or a fresh salad.

recipes.title: Garlic Butter Shrimp
instructions: Prepare Ingredients: Mince the garlic, chop the parsley, and zest one lemon.
Cook Shrimp: In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the shrimp, salt, and pepper.
Add Lemon: Cook shrimp for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until pink and opaque. Squeeze lemon juice over the shrimp and sprinkle with lemon zest.
Finish with Parsley: Remove from heat and sprinkle chopped parsley over the shrimp.
Serve: Serve immediately with a side of crusty bread or over pasta.

recipes.title: Caprese Salad
instructions: Prepare Ingredients: Slice the tomatoes and mozzarella into thick slices.
Assemble Salad: On a serving platter, alternate slices of tomato and mozzarella. Tuck fresh basil leaves in between the slices.
Season: Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve: Serve immediately as a starter or side dish.
